thread.title: Apple fans freak out over Watch fail
thread.title_full: Apple fans freak out over Watch fail

title: Apple fans freak out over Watch fail
text:
— Darren Money AFC (@deemonch) September 16, 2015 WatchOS2 releases today, in what could be a pivotal moment for assessing Apple Watch's functionality. — James Gilmore (@JamesNGilmore) September 16, 2015 
With watchOS 2, app developers can make more sophisticated apps that use the full features of the watch. The Watch apps are about to be quicker, better and more featured. 
But just not yet. 
Last week, at the “monster” Apple event in San Francisco, Apple announced the watchOS 2 would be released on September 16 — the same day as the iOS 9 update for iPhones and iPads. 
But just before the software was due to go out, Apple released a statement saying it had been delayed to another time. 
In the lead up to the launch of the software, app developers working with pre-release versions of the Watch operating system complained that the software was draining the Watch’s battery at an extraordinary rate. Some said the software wasn’t ready for release. 
The reaction from fans was disappointment, outrage and disbelief, all expressed in tweets of 140 characters or less. So angry #WatchOS2 won't be here today — Jd Williams (@jdwilly99) September 16, 2015 Really Apple?! How do you discover a bug at the last minute causing delay of release? Thank goodness you've been beta testing! #WatchOS2 — Tracy Bolte (@balthazar2k4) September 16, 2015 wtf they delayed the WatchOS2 update :(
